title: FPS Stuck at 40 down from 60 middle of match!
body: So was just in a game and I have always ran perfect on max settings 60FPS. Middle of match the game drops to 40FPS and is stuck there. Even if i turn all setting down to very low stays at 40. Restarted PC and game still stuck at 40FPS. Tried other games Smite/Dead by Daylight 60FPS. Any ideas?

This is a problem with League. i am playing many other games 60-100FPS like always. League is the problem i need tech help not a program to kill programs on my pc. But thank you

Low FPS can be caused by a number of different factors. Unstable graphics drivers, windows power settings, and corrupted game files are the biggest causes. While you're not aware of any changes made on your PC that may be causing this issue, the guide that *Rineyy* linked provides **crucial steps** to take in order to resolve this issue. 

If you still encounter low FPS after taking the steps inside that guide, please let me know.
It's not a program, it's a link to a guide to help you resolve your FPS issues with League.

Hi so I might be a bit late but the first thing I would do is download MSI afterburner and install it. I would then turn on GPU temps, GPU usage percentage, fan speed, FPS, CPU usage percentage, and CPU temps, on the monitoring tab in settings. This will allow you to see exactly how hard your hardware is working while playing and if it isn't max and your temps aren't very high while playing league then it is league itself or some of the settings you have in league. You can also turn on RAM usage to see just how much you actually have left while playing. We want to make sure it is league itself, not any hardware issue whatsoever. If you are still getting low FPS. With those on I'd suggest playing an ARAM or even a custom game for awhile so it isn't a massive problem if your FPS is low. If it is a hardware issue, especially an overheating one, then I'd suggest getting a can of condensed air, opening up your case, and cleaning that sucker out if that's something you do not normally do. If it isn't a problem with hardware then something that may help is to turn most settings back up to medium and experiment with what gives you the best FPS. Often times by putting the game down to low or minimum it will shift it usage off of your graphics card and on to your CPU which is why in some games your performance may be better when around medium rather than when you are on low. Other than that I'm not exactly sure what to tell you and perhaps a rioter could help you more than I could. I would like to know what your PC specs are because that maybe be useful info.
